tweets.text: Based in Collingham, Wetherby, Thorpe Arch, Boston Spa or Linton? We‚Äôre investigating flood risk in the Wharfedale area and want to hear from you. Visit https://t.co/2tmx58rqMX #Leeds #RiverWharfe #flooding @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/4WcQXC4Dsn

@richard_ebbs @AquaUoS @RSPBEngland @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience Hi @richard_ebbs. Left is looking downstream from the splay. the right upstream. Below are the same pictures but with (very poor) river flow arrows on them :-)  The right picture shows an 'A' where the first drone picture is taken. Hope this helps. https://t.co/ovH5PD4yAk

Our fisheries enforcement officers regularly patrol waterways checking that anglers have a fishing licence and are fishing legally. Today we're out along the River Trent at Wosley Bridge in #Staffordshire . To learn more about fishing licenses visit https://t.co/h54cBUjB6C. https://t.co/PuXhZcqePl

Fantastic Panel Discussion The State of English #Rivers @Gw4Water Conference this morning. Thank you to our Panel: Arlin Rickard @theriverstrust @acrharrington of @DwrCymru @alicertchie @CLAtweets Helen Wakeham @EnvAgency Mark Squire @NatResWales and Chair @SteveOrmerod https://t.co/xTcDSvuu1d

We are currently looking into what we may be able to do to help - including the possibly of taking samples.

We have contacted @thameswater and will follow this up a.s.a.p.

See thread below in response to recent pollution incidents on the #Wandle near Poulter Park which have heavily discoloured the river on several occasions over the last couple of weeks and affected a substantial stretch downstream. https://t.co/aZlgtETRdE

Our Warwickshire field team have been making sure our national high pressure water pumps are in top condition and ready to be used when needed.  We‚Äôre #flood ready, are you? Check your flood risk now https://t.co/XuFyBxqmQF #Warwickshire https://t.co/lzusuMF5pd

Don't underestimate the size of the European waste mafia which ships waste all over the üåé even in lockdown. Nowadays it's trucked out of UK to end up who knows where. 

In 2018/19 @EnvAgency¬†prevented 13,000 tonnes of waste destined for illegal export.

https://t.co/wsChuIjDzP

Work to encourage channel avulsion on Swindale beck finally crosses tipping point. Recent floods have started an avulsion creating 5 hectares of anastomosing wetland. Minor intervention and patience have eventually paid off!

tweets.text:
Recent heavy rainfall means that some parts of the Midlands and Yorkshire could be at risk of flooding.

Check your local #flood warnings here: https://t.co/BpUpnj1mdd https://t.co/ZaDPpgktbg

Thank you @shrewsburyTC for 2020 #MayorsAwards to our team who worked tirelessly to protect the area during the #floods in February.

The recognition is very much appreciated #flooding https://t.co/SvdbKViaSv

Although times may be difficult for many businesses at the moment, it is important to bear in mind your #floodrisk and take even simple actions to make yourself more flood resilient, such as by signing up to @EnvAgencyNW free flood alerts and warnings! ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/e13FGpysOu https://t.co/V62iESwdln

@Hullfloodrisk @martinaspiers @marksandspencer @UKRI_News @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency @UniversityLeeds @UniOfYork @Hullccnews @ERfloodrisk @floodinnovation We're looking at flood resilience amongst SMEs in the Yorkshire & Humber region (https://t.co/eVTHAb8RB0) @SMEResilienceUK

tweets.text: We are continuing to work around the clock to monitor flood risk and warn communities, following heavy rainfall at the weekend. There are 21 Flood Warnings in force in Yorkshire - please check your local flood risk: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb

There are still flood warnings and alerts out in North Yorks, inc. on River Ure, Swale, Nidd and Ouse following heavy rain. Levels are expected to rise in York over the next 36 hours. The Foss Barrier has been lowered to reduce flood risk to homes. https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/uqdzkdU8br

üåßÔ∏èOctober 2020 was the wettest month in Oxford for 145 years, according to weather observers from @UniofOxford's Radcliffe Meteorological Station, but there's "an increasing probability of crisp, dry and bright winter days" ahead‚òÄÔ∏è... https://t.co/YAL3J6XiL9 https://t.co/5sGPyUFPRJ

tweets.text: Small, still waters like ponds fared much better than rivers in terms of water quality. This is good news for people who are actively restoring ponds, like @PondRiverStream and @norfolkponds (3/5)

@CCWilmers @Caidh @stotfoldmill @AquiferChalk @EnvAgency We were told historically Ivel Springs were revered. A place steeped in myth with mystery. Medieval and Roman inhabitants knew it was precious. Too special to let the environmental vandalism destroy it. Hands off our groundwater.

Excellent AGM for 'https://t.co/D74Y6hsb3m' tonight with fascinating historic survey by Keith Fitzpatrick-Matthews @Caidh @IvelRev @stotfoldmill @AquiferChalk So much done in one year but still no flow in the Ivel. Pull your fingers out @EnvAgency and help our chalkstreams.

tweets.text: Tuesday morning will begin with a band of heavy rain moving from south Wales into central southern England. There will be some snow over the Scottish mountains https://t.co/Kj9JSeMNWZ
@AndynBrown16 @EnvAgencyNW Thanks for all you and the teams are doing up there, Andy.

Time for a night shift as @EnvAgencyNW duty manager. Thankfully much better picture than last night. Not currently expecting further #flood warnings / alerts. Worst of the üåß gone in the next couple of hrs. Info at https://t.co/vKsRlvVySm #floodaware https://t.co/1UlcPY4qUT

New school #RainGarden planter installed for our #SuDSinSchools project. The raining downpipe looks awesome! This visual demonstration will make it clear to pupils that the planters save rain from the drain! #Sudsnotfloods

@Thames_RvrsTrst @EnvAgencySE @Sudsulike @SuttonCouncil https://t.co/8vbWf4vGCD

Our final #FloodHeroes #MayorsAwards is presented to the local #Shrewsbury @EnvAgency the local Shrewsbury Team who without fuss set up our flood defences and monitor rising flood levels, provide support to local organisations, business and residents

It was an honour lastnight to receive this 2020 #MayorsAwards on behalf of #TeamEA who worked so hard to warn, inform and protect the community and businesses of #Shrewsbury during the #floods earlier this year. #ThankYou @ShrewsburyTC @ball_helen @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/YaRJ3LpRWq https://t.co/6jOPskdz6Z

River levels are going down and forecast is set to be better over next few days.  @EnvAgencyNW teams will be making sure all our defences are in working order and we always do a lessons learned so we #improve.  Sad to say that some people were flooded and thought are with them https://t.co/KtzQI0Pvpm

The natural flow split maintains flow along the old route building new features in the reduced energy channel. Gravels are also splaying out from the avulsion zone as natural river and floodplain processes are restored. 

@RSPBEngland @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience @SalfordHydro https://t.co/0mIJpT8sLk

Enhancement of the sediment build up at a frequent breach point on the beck has taken a few floods to instigate channel switching but this process is now well and truly underway with permanent flow over the floodplain 
@RSPBEngland @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience @SalfordHydro https://t.co/qCSePtR8wg
Watch this video by @EnvAgencySE to find out how to ensure your home or business isn't polluting our precious rivers üëá https://t.co/2emkfXjHu1

Check out this video of Becca & Alice from @EnvAgencySE collecting an invertebrate sample to find out what species are living in the river - to help them monitor the river qualityüíß https://t.co/0XwavHRzbg

The government approach to badger culling is not just ineffective, it is  indiscriminate and  unaccountable. It treats wild animals as worthless pests and the protected designated  sites where they live and roam as disposable.
